description: From over- +‎ fold; in the geological sense, after German Überfaltung (“overfolding”).

entries.meaning: (geology) A fold whereby the strata are forced through an angle of more than 90 degrees, so that younger strata lie below older ones.
examples: Thrusts were directed there; major overfolds bulged outwards towards the north.

verbs.description: overfold (third-person singular simple present overfolds, present participle overfolding, simple past and past participle overfolded)

examples: The trick is to not overfold the ingredients; doing so causes the egg whites to deflate, resulting in a flat or soggy soufflé.
